_comment: Example decision context for constitution generation
_usage: Pass this file to: oak constitution create-file --context-file decisions.json
_testing_strategy_description: comprehensive=TDD+high coverage, balanced=test-after OK+moderate coverage, pragmatic=essential tests only
_has_e2e_infrastructure_description: Do you have Playwright/Cypress/Selenium set up?
_e2e_planned_description: Are E2E tests planned for the future?
_critical_integration_points_description: List of integration points requiring tests (array of strings)
testing_rationale: Balanced approach for production application without over-engineering
_testing_rationale_description: Brief explanation of why this testing strategy fits the project
_code_review_policy_description: strict=no exceptions, standard=hotfixes allowed, flexible=optional reviews
_hotfix_definition_description: When can review process be bypassed? (for standard policy)
_documentation_level_description: extensive=all APIs+ADRs, standard=public APIs+README, minimal=README only
_ci_enforcement_description: full=all checks blocking, standard=linting+tests blocking, basic=advisory, none=not yet
_required_checks_description: Array of required CI checks: tests, linting, type-checking, security, coverage
_architectural_pattern_description: How is your code organized? See decision_points.yaml for details on each
_error_handling_pattern_description: How do you handle errors? Result<T,Error> vs exceptions
_domain_events_description: Do you use domain events for decoupling?
_feature_organization_description: For vertical_slice or modular_monolith: how are features/modules organized?
_layer_organization_description: For clean_architecture or layered: what are your layers? (e.g., 'domain, application, infrastructure, presentation')
_coding_principles_description: Key coding principles your team follows (array of strings)
architectural_rationale: Vertical slices enable rapid feature development with clear boundaries and minimal coupling
